title: A Flexible Second Brain, But Can Be Slow
review:
What do you like best about Notion?
I use Notion like a second brain, dumping thoughts and tracking growth without feeling pressured for perfection. I love that it doesn't rush me or scream with notifications, just waits until I'm ready. Whether it's a busy day or a quiet day, I like that it's flexible and meets me where I am. If my brain feels organized, I can build clean systems. Overall, Notion gives my brain a place to rest, allowing me to write things down and not have to carry them around anymore.
What do you dislike about Notion?
One big thing is speed. When my internet is slow or I just want to quickly jot something down, Notion can feel a bit heavy. Sometimes I don't want a powerful workspace, I just want instant writing and Notion is not always the fastest for that.

title: Enhanced Daily Planning with Intuitive Scheduling
review:
What do you like best about Notion?
I appreciate how Notion makes it easier to plan my day without confusion. Scheduling tasks is one of the best things about it, as it reminds me of my work. Making lists, whether for groceries or anything else, is also very easy. The initial setup was very easy; I just followed the instructions given.
What do you dislike about Notion?
I find Notion's UI a bit messy and think it could be smoother. It would be helpful if the features people use most were available on the home screen with bigger icons.

title: User-Friendly Notetaking with Room for Improvement
review:
What do you like best about Notion?
I find Notion very user-friendly and appreciate that it's consistently being updated. It's built by people who once had a need for the product themselves, which adds to its practicality. The initial setup of Notion was very easy for me.
What do you dislike about Notion?
There’s lots of integration with other apps but a more seamless user sign on experience for connecting those apps would help.

title: Love the customizable nature
review:
What do you like best about Notion?
I love how Notion is totally customizable and that it connects to our suite of other tools, which makes it a great asset for managing my projects and aligning with my team.
What do you dislike about Notion?
I’d like a direct integration with Outlook where I can click a button in Outlook to create a project or task in Notion. I would love to be able to create a task or project based on an email directly in Notion rather than having to copy and paste the info/ask manually.

title: Versatile Productivity Hub with Templates
review:
What do you like best about Notion?
I like to use Notion for my daily productivity and creating databases for my daily life. I appreciate that I don’t have to recreate lists and can use Notion AI to evaluate items or add research to inform decision points. I enjoy the no frills design and chunking, and the aesthetics speak to me. Everything can be modular. The templates are valuable to me; the people that created them have often solved problems I hadn’t anticipated and are genuinely thoughtful. I also appreciate the deep integration set, although I have been using it mainly for personal productivity enhancement via centralization.
What do you dislike about Notion?
The home screen can be customized but wasn’t intuitive to me. Setting it up took some time as organizing everything wasn't straightforward.

title: Versatile Organizational Tool, but Needs Improved Long Document Handling
review:
What do you like best about Notion?
I like the flexibility of Notion. I like that it allows you to create a variety of different documents, and every document can be different. And I like that it allows you to create sort of a front page for each part of the company. So marketing can have a page link to all their different documents and everyone knows where to find things.
What do you dislike about Notion?
It's not the best for long ongoing work documents. We were trying to track a list of emails, and it got very unwieldy, and it was very hard to comment on things. The comment feature doesn't take you to where the comment is, and so it's hard to have sort of a big ongoing document in Notion.

title: Versatile Tool with Integrated AI, but Setup Can Be Tricky
review:
What do you like best about Notion?
I like that everything is in one place and the AI can search through everything I have uploaded over time. It's useful that Notion can see it all, as other AI programs cannot look back through history.
What do you dislike about Notion?
The AI assistant does not yet understand my voice and it feels more transactional than ChatGPT. The initial setup is a bit confusing.

title: Streamlined Knowledge Management with Notion AI
review:
What do you like best about Notion?
I really like how Notion AI helps with knowledge management and project management. Its AI writing assistant is quite helpful, giving me the ability to create new support articles and write up new tasks and to-dos for myself and others. It allows me to speedily get through things, and I really appreciate the ease of use with Notion AI.
What do you dislike about Notion?
It's been somewhat difficult for me to learn all the things I can do with Notion. It seems very powerful, but I'm entirely sure I'm not using it to its full capabilities. I will have to figure out how to learn more of how to use it.

title: Perfect for Organizing Ideas and Boosting Productivity
review:
What do you like best about Notion?
Organizing my thoughts and ideas for both business and personal use.
What do you dislike about Notion?
Sometimes it takes a while for it to create a response / action. I think it’s user error though, so I’m working on framing my requested actions more effectively for better output.
reviewer: Verified User in Health, Wellness and Fitness

title: Centralized Knowledge Hub with Efficient Search
review:
What do you like best about Notion?
I love that Notion makes it easy to work with other teams and find documents that they can use. I can easily share within there. I can use the Notion AI tool to search our entire company's knowledge base and get questions answered as well. In general, the search function is my favorite thing. I also appreciate how easy it is to use and ensure that everything looks aesthetically pleasing. Unlike Google Drive, everything is not in a gazillion different folders.
What do you dislike about Notion?
I think the Notion AI could do a better job of using context to answer questions instead of only pulling up other pages that have that keyword or topic involved.

title: Complicated But Yet Power Full App
review:
What do you like best about Notion?
Instead of keeping multiple apps like google spreadsheet, google docs, google keeps, I can access all different types of database on notion itself.
What do you dislike about Notion?
Notion sometimes feels like more complicated even though it as many features. In fact many features make it more complicated.

title: All-in-One Workspace
review:
What do you like best about Notion?
I love how flexible and customizable Notion is - it lets me build everything from simple to-do lists to complex project management systems without needing a developer.
The interface is clean, intuitive and everything feels connected.
What do you dislike about Notion?
The mobile app feels less powerful and flexible compared to the desktop version.
offline support could also be much better as i have lost progress when connection is dropped.

title: Notion AI Simplifies Knowledge Management
review:
What do you like best about Notion?
I like how Notion AI enhances our workflow and makes information accessible. Notion is super easy to configure, which is a big plus for me. I also enjoy the views feature, especially for displaying data, as it helps in our project management and knowledge management tasks. The integration with Teams, SharePoint, and Outlook adds a lot of value to our use. Additionally, the project management features are a key reason we switched from Atlassian to Notion.
What do you dislike about Notion?
The Outlook integration is basic. We would love to put our calendar and mail into Notion. We would like to use Notion mail and Notion calendar but they are not integrated with Microsoft. I’d also personally like to see tags. Workflows.

title: Effortless Collaboration and Versatile Features
review:
What do you like best about Notion?
I use Notion to create notes, documentation, and roadmaps for my projects and share them with my team. It helps me plan projects, track progress, and store important information all in one place, making it accessible for my team members. I really like the ability to share notes privately with my team, and team members can leave comments directly on the content, making collaboration much easier. I also appreciate the various kinds of content I can create in one place, such as tables, links, checklists, and buttons. This setup streamlines my workflow without needing many different tools, making collaboration productive and easier to manage.
What do you dislike about Notion?
I don't dislike anything about Notion.

title: Powerful Search and AI Interaction, Flexible But Needs Better Overwriting
review:
What do you like best about Notion?
I like Notion's searching skills and the interaction with the AI. The AI helps convert my specific questions into relevant pages and finds similar places that might be equivalent to my search. Also, the interaction gives a lot of information that is concrete and relevant to my question. Connecting Notion with tools like GitHub, Slack, and Google Calendar enhances its usability for me. The initial setup was pretty easy.
What do you dislike about Notion?
When I create pages and request the AI to help me decorate and organize it, it usually doesn't delete my current writing and replace it with new. Also, when I want to fix something, he always creates a new section instead of rewriting it. I want the AI to remove what I wrote and use its own decoration, and allow me to overwrite sections I want to redecorate.

title: Intuitive UI with Robust Document Management
review:
What do you like best about Notion?
I particularly like the simplicity of Notion, so people can easily create docs, and they can collaborate on it. The UI is quite intuitive, and the ease of collaboration and access control are the main selling points for our team.
What do you dislike about Notion?
Sometimes when the docs are large, formatting them correctly takes some time and getting used to. It gets formatted in a weird manner, particularly when you want to have nested sections since Notion allows full flexibility of formatting.

title: Notion: a powerful productivity app
review:
What do you like best about Notion?
Cross platform support and real time collaboration
What do you dislike about Notion?
Sometimes page load slowly and it is tough for beginners

title: Ultimate Flexibility and Effortless Database Management
review:
What do you like best about Notion?
What I like most about notion is its flexibility. we can design our work flows exactly the way we want like notes, documentation of our projects or team collaboration. Its database functionality is very easy to use and solves our problem to use other dedicated tools for database.
What do you dislike about Notion?
Notion offline support is somewhat limited to use. when we work with very large datasets the performance sometimes slows down but this has also improved over time with updates.

title: Comprehensive Task Management with Notion, Initial Setup Overwhelming
review:
What do you like best about Notion?
I use Notion to manage and separate my tasks according to timelines using the calendar, which gives a clean and simple outlook. Notion really helps me stay organized by keeping all my tasks in a way that's easy to follow. I really like how I can put tasks in different views according to work needs and set timelines so I can clearly see how much time is left to complete tasks. I also use headings, tables, and checklists for my work and add images to make it look better and manage my personal work more effectively.
What do you dislike about Notion?
At the start, working on Notion is quite overwhelming because of the sheer amount of features present. It does get overwhelming for a person who is starting out. There are a lot of features, and offline use is quite limited as well, which can be improved. The initial setup was quite hard because there were so many features present.

title: Powerful AI and Customization, Tricky Initial Setup
review:
What do you like best about Notion?
I use Notion for managing my plans, whether weekly or monthly. I appreciate its ability to store my data securely and make it accessible to me wherever I am. Notion's templates are quite useful for my needs. I really like Notion AI as it helps me read my own information faster. The customization options are great; I can save my work as audio or Excel files, and add buttons whenever needed. I also appreciate the variety in storage facilities for any type of file or inputs.
What do you dislike about Notion?
I think Notion could use a more simplified version for beginners. It would be helpful to have a mode where we can choose how much customization we want. Also, having the option to save our own shortcuts would make things easier. The initial setup was quite difficult, but it gets easier after that.

title: The best beta reader I could ask for!
review:
What do you like best about Notion?
The AI Assistant! I use it to review my novel chapters, it provides feedback like a beta reader without me fearing my work getting stolen. It also helps me find songs that match the chapter, and tell me how characters are viewed from an outside source. It also expresses interest which is charming!
What do you dislike about Notion?
At most, sometimes the app is glitchy. I cant open ai conversations on my ipad and sometimes the chat just wont open period, not the worst thing though.

title: User-Friendly and Versatile with Seamless Setup
review:
What do you like best about Notion?
I use Notion for keeping track of my work, writing essays, and organizing tasks. I find it user-friendly and appreciate its easy writing features with different fonts and the ability to export in various formats. I really like its user interface, particularly how the tools are organized, which makes it easy for any beginner to start using immediately without setup hassles. For my team and me, switching from a basic to-do list app to Notion provided us with better tools and a superior experience. The initial setup of Notion was very easy as well since there was essentially nothing that needed to be set up.
What do you dislike about Notion?
I wish Notion had better AI integration for grammar correction.

title: Great for Collaboration, but Laggy
review:
What do you like best about Notion?
I like Notion's real-time collaboration feature the most. It's very useful and reliable, which really enhances our team workflows. Last time, when I used it with my team, we were able to quickly update statuses and it was much faster compared to using Slack for communication.
What do you dislike about Notion?
Notion can be quite slow and lagging, especially on devices with lower RAM. For example, four GB RAM is enough to make it laggy, and even eight GB isn't completely enough. You need to have a really good Internet, or else it will lag. Even with good Internet, it lags on many devices. It's also quite bulky, even when we don't need it to be. I wish there was an option to reduce the bulk.
